title: James Blunt says criticism of his old army friend Prince Harry is 'vitriolic'
text:
James Blunt has said 'vitriolic' press coverage of his old Army friend Prince Harry and Meghan Markle is 'leaning on bullying'.

The singer, who attended the couple's wedding in 2018, said on Good Morning Britain today: 'I do know them, I might have spoken briefly about it.

'What I think I can see is that they seem to be on the cover of the newspapers a lot and it seems to be vitriolic quite a lot of the time.'

Blunt, who was a guest at the Sussexes' wedding, praised the Duke's charity work and recalled his time serving with Harry.

'Him I know from the Army,' he said. 'He's a very nice man, a really phenomenal soldier, who does a lot of work for other people, for charities, for veterans, for Sentebale charity, for children in Africa, and I think under great scrutiny they seem to try a lot for other people. So the vitriol seems a bit like leaning on bullying to me.'

His remarks to Ben Shephard and Penny Lancaster on this morning's show follow Meghan's appearance at the 2019 One Young World summit last night.

James Blunt is pictured (left) with Sofia Wellesley at Windsor Castle for the wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle on May 19 2018. Right: Harry and Meghan on their African tour

The Duchess put on a brave face as she attended an event at the Royal Albert Hall in central London.

It was her first public appearance after the bombshell ITV documentary in which she admitted public scrutiny had left her feeling 'vulnerable'.

The singer told Good Morning Britain that some of the coverage of his old Army friend had been vitriolic

The official opening of the 2019 One Young World summit, in Kensington, west London took place just hours after a source close to her and Prince Harry told CNN the couple are 'single-handedly' modernising the monarchy.

Meghan, 38, attended without Prince Harry, in her role as vice-president of the Queen's Commonwealth Trust, which partnered with One Young World to bring 53 young leaders to the summit.

The Sussexes are to take a six-week break from royal duties from the end of next month to enjoy some 'family time'.

Buckingham Palace has not officially commented on the couple's 'private' travel plans.

But it is understood they will spend Thanksgiving, on November 28, in the US with the duchess's mother Doria Ragland and return to the UK for Christmas with the Royal Family.

James Blunt (pictured with Prince Harry during rehearsals for the Invictus Games closing ceremony in 2014) said the Duke was a 'phenomenal' soldier during their time in the Army

Sources stressed on Monday that the break should not be seen as a 'holiday' but time to bond after a busy year.

Meghan barely took three months of maternity leave, working on projects including her guest editorship of Vogue and the launch of her charity clothing line.

A source told the Daily Mail: 'It's more in the spirit of winding down and taking some family time towards the end of the year.'
description: James Blunt hinted that he'd spoken to his old Army friend the Duke of Sussex about the scrutiny he and Meghan have faced as described the coverage as 'vitriolic quite a lot of the time'.
